postcontent:
I am selling two bulk packed bags of 100 rounds each of this high quality personal defense frangible ammo.  This is 50% of the going retail cost. My price is $100 for 200 rounds. This is some of the highest quality ammo on the market and normally sells for $1.20/rd. With comparable velocity to an FN 5.7x28mm, the Liberty Civil Defense ammo is a 60 grain, lead-free, monolithic hollow point round that generates muzzle velocity of greater than 2000 feet per second for your .40 cal handgun. This round has significantly increased accuracy and penetration with reduced recoil vs traditional .40 hollow point ammunition.

You can see how much the ammo is selling for here: http://www.midwayusa.com/product/914467/liberty-civil-defense-ammunition-40-s-and-w-60-grain-fragmenting-hollow-point-lead-free-box-of-20

title: For Sale:  Standard Pressure Short Barrel Low Flash Heavy .38 Special Ammo - 150 gr. Hard Cast Wad Cutter (850fps/M.E. 241 ft. lbs.) - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=111

Due to customer demand, we've developed this defensive 38SPL ammo. Our customers wanted some devastating 38SPL loads that would fill the following criteria. 

1. It won't hurt older/fragile/alloy revolvers. (Non +P)
2. Is effective as a "fight stopper" through the use of proper bullets. 
3. Is more powerful than typical/standard, weak 38SPL ammo.
4. Generate much less recoil than our +P 38SPL ammo.
5. Is flash suppressed.

Buffalo Bore is introducing these three different heavy, yet standard pressure loadings for 38 SPL. These offerings are loaded at standard pressure, but they are much more powerful than normal 38SPL ammo. These loads will not harm older more fragile revolvers. So, these loads are safe for use in ANY 38 SPL revolver, provided it is in normal working condition. As stated above, the "POWER" level of these loads is really closer to a typical +P power level, but the pressure is standard. We are able to develop these powerful standard pressure loads with modern non-canister powders. Again, these loads recoil far less than our +P 38 SPL ammo. 

This load is flash suppressed, so firing it in the dark wont blind you. We use flash suppressed powder in our defensive ammo in the loadings whenever possible as over 90% of all civilian shootings in America, occur in low light, when the criminal element is at work. We don't want you blinded by your own gunfire after the first shot. 

Item 20D utilizes a very hard cast 150gr. WAD CUTTER bullet. The bullet is made hard, so it won't deform or mushroom. It cuts/crushes a "cookie cutter", full diameter hole in human flesh just like it does on a paper target. It penetrates deeply (roughly 14 to 16 inches in human tissue) and its full diameter profile maximizes blood loss as it cuts and crushes (not slips or slides) its way through tissue. Although I've never been shot with a full profile wad cutter bullet, I must assume that the initial impact of that wide flat nosed bullet, is crushingly formidable. As a teenager, I took to the woods on a regular basis and killed many a critter with heavily loaded 38SPL wad cutters'. The effect of a full profile wad cutter on small game was obvious and amazing, compared to regular round nosed bullets. That flat nose, literally hammers living things. These bullets are hard and properly lubed and will NOT lead your barrel. Note my velocities from real world "over the counter" revolver s- NOT TEST BARRELS!

a. S&W mod. 60, 2 inch barrel - 868 fps (251 ft. lbs.) 
b. S&W mod. 66, 2.5 inch barrel - 890 fps (264 ft. lbs.)
c. Ruger SP101, 3 inch barrel - 961 fps (308 ft. lbs.)
d. S&W Mt. Gun, 4 inch barrel - 1005 fps (336 ft. lbs.)

title: For Sale:  Firearm Hydrodipping: Customize your guns with over 700 brand-name camo's, wood grains, carbon fiber, and more!
location: Fort Collins (contact for location), Fort Collins, Colorado
postcontent:
I operate NOCO Hydrographics here in Fort Collins. If you're looking to get a firearm hydrodipped, I offer both the best prices as well as the best quality materials. I know how important quality is when it comes to any firearm work, and that's why I strive to be the best in the business. When you bring me one of your firearms, you can rest assured that the job will be done right, and come out looking great. After the pattern is applied, the part is coated with a high-strength clear coat with an internal flex agent. This means that the clear will flex without cracking when the gun is fired, and will last through many years of use.

I have over 700 patterns available in categories such as:
Camouflage
Carbon Fiber
Wood Grain
Stone
Metal
and Designer

You can check out the full gallery of films on my supplier's site here:
http://www.watertransferprinting.com/Films.html
Most films can be paired with a custom base color of your choosing as well.

Below is a rough-estimate pricing list, however prices may change due to unique aspects of each project:
Semi-auto handguns: $180
- frame only: $120
- slide only: $80
Revolvers (entire gun): $180
Long Rifles (1 pc. stock, coating barrel and receiver): $250
- Barrel and receiver only: $150
- Stock only: $100
Rifles w/ tactical stocks (AR's, AK's, etc, for covering entire rifle): $250
- furniture excluding receiver: $150

If you're interested in having something done, give me a call or email me at the contact info below. I can apply a hydrographic pattern to any wood, metal, or plastic surface, so if you're interested in having a non-firearm piece done, I can give you a quote.

Jordan Mccullugh
NOCO Hydrographics
REDACTED (please note the area code is NOT 970)
REDACTED

Check us out on Facebook too: https://www.facebook.com/NoCoHydrographics

One of the respondents at a firearms enthusiast web site said "I bought a Savage 111 in 30.06 about 20 years ago. It has been the best, most accurate deer rifle I've ever had. It is a true MOA shooter with no mods at all. There are not enough adjectives to describe my utter joy when I behold this gem. It was obviously sent from heaven to complete my life."  Another on the same forum said "I've had several Savage 111's and the only one that I was disappointed with was a tactical rifle.  The hunting guns were great. And finally a third said "It's a good rifle. I had one many years ago, but had to sell it. title: For Sale:  TAVOR SAR 5.56MM FDE 18" 30+1 FLAT TOP/BULL PUP/18"
postcontent:
Lightly used-TAVOR SAR Flattop 18" Flat Dark Earth finish

At the end of the 1982 Israel-Lebanon War arose an understanding that the modern battlefield had changed. One of the conclusions from the war, particularly relevant to the small arms industry, was that the battle had moved from open field conflicts to close-quarters engagements – and there was a need for a seamless transition from daylight to nighttime capability on a single mission. Out of this understanding, and after more than a decade of collaboration and testing with the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) - the TAVOR® rifle was born. Just as race car technology trickles down to consumer automobiles, so do these time and battle-tested firearms now become a modern sporting rifle platform for civilian gun enthusiasts.

The TAVOR® is a perfect fusion of an ordnance grade steel receiver coupled to a Mil-Spec cold hammer forged barrel and encased into a high-impact strength polymer uni-body with exceptional situational ergonomics. The ultra-compact form factor allows for easy transitions in close quarter situations…or even in your favorite deer blind. The bullpup design moves the center of gravity of the rifle closer to the users’ body allowing for more instinctive aiming and improved acquisition time to target. This innovative design also allows for a full length barrel, which means no loss of down range ballistic accuracy. Near and far range accuracy is enhanced by the minimized recoil provided by a non-lubricated long stroke gas piston system. With the exception of a hand-specific locking bolt, the rifle is completely ambidextrous allowing for easy left-hand conversion of the operating handle, ejection port, fire-control safety, sling swivel receptacles and fore-mounted accessory Picatinny rail. The TAVOR® is supplied with IDF-tested and approved magazines – but you can also use your own AR-15/M16 style magazines.

Bullpup configuration; short rifle convenience with long rifle accuracy
Mil-Spec , chrome lined, cold-hammer forged CrMoV barrel, 6 groove 1:7 RH twist
Optional 9mm Parabellum conversion kit with CHF barrel, 1:10 twist, CrMoV steel
Optional 5.45x39mm conversion kit with CHF CrMoV barrel, 1:7½ twist, chrome lined
100% ambidextrous configuration and operation with optional left hand bolts for 5.56 NATO and 5.45x39mm
Integral folding adjustable backup iron sights with Tritium front post (flat top models only)
Integral ambidextrous front and rear quick detachable sling swivel receptacles
Simple field stripping into easily serviceable subassemblies
Mil-Std 100% interchangeability of all TAVOR® SAR parts
Mil-Std bayonet lug on 18" barreled models
Uses standard AR-15/M16 magazines
Last round hold open on empty magazine
All metal parts are treated for corrosion resistance
Integral rubber recoil pad
Assembled in the US from Israeli and US manufactured parts
Optimized ergonomic design for increased comfort and ease of use
Clean, long stroke piston operation
Body constructed of high-strength impact modified polymer

$30.00 flat rate shipping

title: For Sale/Trade:  1976 Ruger 10/22 "200th Year of American Liberty"
postcontent:
I have a Ruger 10/22 from 1976, "The 200th Year of American Liberty" I would like to trade/sell. The rifle is in good condition, and shoots great. Overall I would say the rifle is in 90%, there is some wear in the finish on the receiver, trigger guard, and butt plate but this is merely cosmetic. The rifle shoots great, it is accurate and reliable. Includes (1) 25 round magazine, a cheap 3-9x40 scope, and the original bicentennial barrel. 

This 10/22 is one of the rare old ones, these were made with no plastic and has a better quality of parts. The rifle has a walnut stock with a metal butt plate, a metal barrel band, and metal trigger guard. The original barrel (included) has "The 200th Year of American Liberty"  on the side of the barrel (some people call this the bicentennial 10/22). This original barrel had a chip out of the crown so I replaced it with a new factory barrel (sale includes both barrels). 

I love the rifle, it is a great shooter, but I have two of them so one of them needs to go.

title: For Sale:  FNH SCAR RANGER PACKAGE 7.62mm .308 fn fnh scar 17s mk 17 trijicon rmr 6x acog magpul
postcontent: COMPLETE U.S. ARMY RANGER DEPLOYMENT PACKAGE! Ranger's have been using the select fire FNH SCAR .308 Mark 17 in FDE (flat dark earth)for a few years now.. these FNH 17S units with 16" chrome lined barrel (16k service life), aluminum receiver w/ 4 rails, flash hider, folding stock, collapsible, adjustable LOP, adjustable, comb, ambi controls w/ switchable charging handle, folding front rear FNH factory sights, five (5) factory 20 round matching magazines, Hardigg military issue (Ranger edition) laser cut case holds SCAR w/ folded stock and all accessories, rollers, matching FDE foregrip. The SCAR is delivered as a battle carbine with battle trigger which means they are horrific.. Special Forces unit armorers have replaced these units with Geissele units (select fire) from the beginning and cleaned up the interiors. That said Rangers are for the most part stuck with the factory units.. these upgraded SCAR units DO have Geissele trigger units installed; 2 stage with second release 2-2.5lbs enabling precision work. Shown with the Trijicon 6x issue ACOG. This unit is simply awesome with a BDC ballistic drop compensator out to 1200 meters.. target at 800? Put the "8" on it. 1200 meters away.. put the"12" on target. Steel cap retention devices, distance/range use, red chevron, upper picatinny rail, fiber optics (adjustable) for day with tritium for night. Battery free, waterproof 100+ meters, dustproof. This system is an awesome platform but for room clearing 6x is too much. Optics package includes an offset Trijicon RMR system also with chevron. Enables fast target acquisition for close quarter battle/ room clearing. On an offset 45 degree mount which allows you to easily switch from 6x to 1x and vice versa. This system also mounts on the top of the 6x ACOG (piggyback).

"J. Stevens Arms Company was founded in 1864 at Chicopee Falls, MA as J. Stevens & Co.  In 1886 the name was changed to J. Stevens Arms and Tool Co. title: For Sale/Trade:  Savage 111 LRH 7mm Rem Mag w/ dies, brass, projectiles
postcontent:
I have a Savage 111 Long Range Hunter chambered in 7mm that I would primarily like to trade for a short action model 10/model 11 platform. 7mm-08 and 260 Remington setups would get first preference with .308 and same bolt face's second preference. Absolutely must be short action and absolutely must be Savage.

This rifle has exactly 80 rounds down the tube. It includes the accustock and a closeable muzzle break. The tip of the forend slightly touched the barrel so I lightly sanded it to ensure free-floating (this was done w/ proper dowel and wouldn't be noticed had I not said something). It will also come with an EGW 20 MOA rail but not the scope, rings, or bipod.

Also included in the package is 300-500 pieces of once/twice fired brass. I bought some once fired from others and have inspected 90% of it.. no obvious cracks or extremely loose pockets so I believe it to be once fired. 

I have about 80-100 168gr GMAX, 100+ 168gr Interlocks, 50 140gr Nosler E-tips, and 50 of something else but I can't quite remember.

Lastly, this will come with RCBS 7mm Full Lenth X-Die, Neck Die, and sizer. I also have a collet die for belted magnums that sells new for $100 (I'd recommend using this the most to get more cycles from the brass). Oh... and I have the Hornady LNL brass casing for 7mm Rem Mag so I will include that too. :)

Air pulled 154gr Interlocks with 58.5gr of IMR 4831 got me .6MOA. I was also using Tula LRM's and guessed at my correct torque (without overtorquing) so I feel like the rifle would do slightly better with a more capable shooter.

I'd prefer a trade of equal or near equal (give or take boot) on a Savage 7mm-08/.260 rig w/ reloading components. If 7mm-08, I'd keep the projectiles.

Could be had for a cash price of $1250 plus shipping and FFL fees if applicable. I would not be willing to part with the reloading components/dies unless a deal on the rifle has been finalized with another buyer/trader.

E-mail me if interested in a trade or want to give a reasonable offer. I can text pictures easier than uploading so include your number if you would like me to send pictures. The rifle is like new and the brass should last an experienced reloader for the lifetime of the barrel if the collet die is utilized properly. 

*Obligatory Armslist Note* This rifle has been greatly cared for and is truly in like new condition. I will not negotiate with Armlist regulars over minor cosmetic blemishes or the fact that I correctly free-floated this barrel. If the fact that 80 rounds have been down the tube bother you then please buy new. If I wanted to get nickled and dimed over minor blems/improved performance then I'd take it to a pawn shop.

title: For Sale:  Ruger SR-556 Carbine **NEW IN BOX**
postcontent: The SR-556 offers Ruger's legendary rugged reliability, and comes factory standard with a host of accessories that today's shooters demand. Employing a patent-pending, chrome-plated, two-stage piston driven operating system that provides the user with a cleaner, cooler running, reliable firearm that is truly state-of-the-art. The chrome-lined gas block and chrome-plated piston and regulator work together to provide a smooth power delivery stroke to the bolt carrier. The by-products of the gas system are vented out the bottom of the gas block, away from the bolt carrier, keeping the action clean and free from contaminants. The end result is significantly improved performance over gas driven rifles. It features a black synthetic collapsible stock, 16.12" barrel with a Manganese Phosphate/Hardcoat Anodized finish, shoots 5.56mm NATO and .223 Rem. and ships with 3 Magpul P-MAG Magazines.
